intro: Isoglossa onilahensis, commonly known as the Malagasy isoglossa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
